text: Note: There is also a "Sweyn Holm" off St Ninian's Isle, Shetland Sweyn Holm is a small island in the Orkney Islands, next to Gairsay. It is thought to be named for Sweyn Asleifsson (Sveinn), who was connected with Gairsay or possibly a corruption of "servant's island" in Norse. ==Geography and geology== Sweyn Holm is made up of red sandstone. ==References== Category:Uninhabited islands of Orkney
title: Sweyn Holm
